ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Light workload, neat concept. Many classes at Yale are such that you get out what you put in, but I really don't think this is one of them -- it's a pretty low payoff regardless. I don't think I'd recommend this to someone for any reason other than its ease.

I wouldn't take this class. It's more of a lecture than a seminar. Professor Tomlinson always shows up a few minutes late. The readings sound really cool, but I found them to be boring and dry. If you're considering taking this class, definitely take a look at the readings to see if you like them.

Highly recommended. Super smart professor will guide you through reading some of the most important science texts you can read. I learned a lot. Class was a little more humanities-ish than I'm used to, which was a challenge, but it was a good time. Writing assignments are not long but can be tricky to think about. I enjoyed this class more than I thought I would.
